revised_title: Deep-Sea Dredgings and Soundings in the South Atlantic: Observations and Findings
tldr: This article discusses the author's observations and findings from dredgings and deep-sea soundings in the South Atlantic during a voyage from the Cape of Good Hope to Australia. The author describes the abundant animal life, similar to that of the North Atlantic, and the various types of marine invertebrates found at different depths. The article also highlights the different types of bottom deposits and their composition, including the 'Globigerina-ooze' and the influence of melting icebergs on the sediment.
